column1: length at leg stump, allows it to slide on and closes the face for a single at fine leg
nice flowing drive, straight to mid-off. It's full and just outside off. No movement at all and this makes a nice sound off the bat
short of a length just outside off, mistimed cut into the covers
nicely done. Full on the pads and he's stable as this lands in his area. Chips it over wide mid-on
full outside off, driven to mid-off off the low part of the bat
length at off stump, defended solidly down the pitch
yorker length just outside off. Digs it out into the off side
gets it over point but he wasn't in control. That swung away late from a good length, but he had plenty of room wide outside off. Was looking to slap that through cover
length on off stump, punched firmly to mid-off
length at off stump, nicely behind the line to defend this

clears the boundary with a drive off the toe-end! Munro with the full swing, and barely any connection has managed to clear the long-off boundary. Overpitched ball outside off and it was a good option, even if the execution wasn't all there

Hafeez pedals backwards and holds on at mid-off! That's a poor shot from Munro. Could have done all the things he did last ball to get the result he was looking for here, but he has looked to go across the line at a length ball. It's at off stump, he's looking to go wide of mid-on. Gets it off the toe-end again and Hafeez does very nicely to track this to his right as he jogs backwards and lunges to hold on
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and runs this down to third man
length just outside off, tapped on the up to point
short and wide outside off, swishes and misses
length on middle stump, nudged to mid-on's left against the angle
length on middle stump, defended into the midwicket region
length just outside off, defended off the front foot
yorker at leg stump and Worker is late bringing the bat down on this. But it deflects fine off his pad
runs away fine but this time there's no chance for anyone to get a touch on it. It's length, it's angled well down leg side
length outside off, left alone

they've got Williamson! New Zealand's captain taking a stroll down the pitch at the non-striker's end, hasn't even had the chance to react as Shaheen gets a finger before the ball hits the stumps. It's a length ball on off stump, punched on the up back at the bowler who can't collect cleanly. But he'll collect the wicket with glee. Shaheen has punched a hole into New Zealand's top order
overpitched ball wide outside off, sweet connection on the cover drive and it looks to be flying away through extra cover on the bounce before that fielder leaps to his left to get a hand on it
length on the pads, whipped to fine leg with the angle
full and slanted across the corridor. Left alone
length and angled away outside off. Left alone
full outside off, driven on the bounce to point where Shadab flies to his left to parry it in cover's direction
length outside off, sliced on the up and Shadab flies the other way this time to save runs. High to his right
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at off stump, squeezes it away from his body into the off side
length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket on the up

beautiful. Expertly done from Ross Taylor. This is full and cutting away from middle and off, but he's got his head over the line and not allowed that to move too far away. Clipped wide of mid-on and the fielders have no chance
full on leg stump, nudged behind square with a closed face
length outside off, left alone
length just outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
full on middle stump, mistimed punch to mid-on
short of a length just outside off, guides it straight to backward point on the bounce
full and down leg side. Worker swipes at it but can't connect
length on middle stump, turned behind square on the leg side off the pads
length just outside off, tapped on the up to point
length on off stump, tapped on the up to mid-off
length outside off, bat-pad situation as he looks to defend on the front foot. He was outside the line and the half-appeals are turned down
length on middle stump, defended down the pitch
short of a length just outside off, guided to third man with an angled bat
length on middle stump, defended to midwicket on the front foot
short of a length outside off, rises steeply as he shuffles to get behind it and open up the leg side. Thumps his thigh guard as he looks to pull
length and in at off stump, defended into the leg side with a closed face

oh dear. An effort so deliciously dual-natured, it could only have come from Pakistan. Short of a length and in at middle stump. He short-arm pokes it behind square with the attempted pull. Imam gives chase and slides nicely to his left as he picks it up. Then he looks to flick it to the fine leg fielder running towards him and ends up lobbing it over him...and into the boundary
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
shot. Length and in at off stump. Shuffles and manages to get behind the line this time. Uses the climb up at him to clear square leg with a flick
length on off stump, tapped to mid-on with the angle
length and just outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
length on off stump, mistimed drive to short extra's left. He dives but can't collect cleanly and they steal a single
appeal for lbw. Might have been going over. He belts it in at a length and it's headed on an off stump line. Worker looks to whip it but is trapped in the crease, at about thigh height
full on middle stump, mistimed drive to mid-on
length outside off. Jumps into line and clips this to mid-on
length outside off, sliced on the up through cover. A hand on it from Imam but he won't collect cleanly. They pick up two as a result of the deflection
in control and behind the line as he punches this past the non-striker. Length ball angles in and he's right on top of it as he offers the full face
full outside off, defended on the front foot
length and in at off stump, tickled behind square with a flick
length just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, defended to cover off the front foot
lunges forward and works this indrifter to midwicket
tucks it away with the angle to square leg
looks to paddle fine but misses it completely. Sarfraz fumbles down leg and they take a bye. Wasn't far from leg stump.
pushed through quicker on off, defended.
steps out and works this down to Shaheen Shah Afridi at long-on
punched to midwicket, where Shadab dives to his left and stops.
slower and fuller delivery angling in, defended back

opens the bat face late to steer this down to Afridi, who is extremely agile running around the ropes to cut that off. He had to get to the ground floor from the fifth floor, which he did in a jiffy! (Okay, sorry)
steered down to third man again, Afridi's your man stopping it.

super shot! Hint of width and Taylor slaps this on the bounce over point, third man comes around to cut that off. Taylor's favourite shot the square drive. Faheem with the charge followed by the slide and a parry to Imam
turns this into the leg side to midwicket
works this off a thick inside edge to midwicket
works this towards short midwicket again.
steps out and works this down to long-on
punches this to midwicket
tossed up but this skids through from a length on off, defended back to Hafeez. Literally  no pace to work with for Taylor
drifts in and skids through, leading edge that rolls back towards the bowler.
nice flight, lands this just outside off, Taylor stabs this away.
gets this to jag back in off a length from outside off, defended from the crease.
walks across the stumps and bunts this length delivery to third man for an easy single
slips this down leg from round the stumps. Some exercise for Nigel Llong.
hits the hard length again, some bounce off the deck as well but Taylor has the line covered as he defends.
gets half a stride in as he punches this into the covers.
top-edges the pull but this one just eludes Sarfraz and rolls towards fine leg.
tucks this wide of midwicket
works this towards the man coming in from deep midwicket for another single
makes room and whips this to short midwicket, the ball is parried towards mid-on as they take a single

he's cleaned him up! Worker steps out to whip this, but the ball drifted in a long way, dipped on him and beat his swing to crash into middle. Played all around it, got into a tangle and has to go. Worker's struggle is over and they'll grab a drink.
works this towards deep midwicket to get off the mark.

what happened there? Hafeez attempted to lob this up to entice him to drive, but the ball slipped out completely and ended up going so high. As it descended, Taylor, who could've well let it go, looks to give this a proper whack, but misses altogether. Everyone has a laugh, wide called. Taylor should really be kicking himself for missing out
punched towards mid-on.
stands tall and defends back
slips this length ball into middle and leg, beaten by the pace. The ball deflects off the pad into the off side.
punches straight to point.
driven back, nearly a return catch on his followthrough. Took a while for him to react on is followthrough. Will go down as a chance, a tough chance.
punched on the up but straight to Shadab at point.

this is a sensational yorker, one that would've made Wasim Akram proud. Full, dead straight to begin with, but it tails in really late to surprise Latham, who jams his bat down to keep it out but ends up playing down the wrong line. The ball sneaks through the inside edge to smash the stumps. This is excellent, excellent bowling. Let off earlier in the over, but can't make Pakistan pay. What a bowler this Shaheen Shah Afrifdi. Pakistan are chipping away!
tossed up outside off, defended back.
lunges forward and defends back.
works this off a length to midwicket
slower length ball, punched down to long-on
chops this away into the off side as he attempts a cut
slider which he punches back to the bowler.
angles in a length delivery from round the stumps, defended towards midwicket
mistimes a drive, but into the gap between cover and mid-off.
width, steered down to square third man.
wrists this from outside off towards midwicket for a quick single.
another yorker which he looks to squeeze behind point bus misses. This was off-target. Superb bowling.
right behind the line, gets in a proper forward stride as he keeps that out.
turns this gently towards short mid-on.
looks to paddle, then ends up tucking it into the gap between midwicket and square leg.
nice flight, lands this on off, Nicholls is properly forward as he blocks.
goes right back and across as he defends.
nice flight, properly forward as he smothers the spin.
makes a bit of room and punches this shortish delivery to sweeper cover.
punches this full toss down to long-on
spins away from a length outside off, Taylor shapes to cut but leaves in the end.
driven with the spin to Imam at short cover.
hint of width, forced through the line to sweeper cover.
driven down to long-off, got right to the pitch of the ball that time
googly which he reads off the pitch and tucks to the leg side.
length at off stump, stabbed into the cover
length on off stump, tapped to extra cover on the up
short of a length and skidding into middle stump. Punched to long-on
length on middle stump, pushed towards long-on but midwicket will cut that off
lobbed up full outside off, tickled to midwicket's right with soft hands
length at off stump, backs away and punches to long-off
length on the stumps, tapped off the front foot
length at middle stump, blocked on the front foot
full toss at leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
full and down leg side, can't get bat on the sweep
short of a length skidder outside off, mistimed cut to point
short outside off, chopped straight to point
length outside off, dead-batted into the pitch
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length on middle stump, punched back at Hafeez who misfields
length on off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length ball on the pads, flicked to deep square's right and they pick up a second
length on middle, steps out and drives to long-on
length ball pushed through at off stump. Can't get this punch past midwicket
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at middle stump, nudged to midwicket's left and the fielder is caught flat-footed
length outside off, walks into this poke away from the body but under-edges into the pitch
short and wide outside off, chopped to point
length on off stump, driven on the up to extra cover
slider at a length outside off. Tapped towards long-on but the bowler gets across
length at leg stump, backs away and taps to extra cover
length on leg stump, cops it on the pad as he looks to flick
length on middle stump, hurriedly nudged to long-on from deep in the crease
tossed up at middle stump, met at the pitch after stepping out and driven to long-on
full outside off, steps out and looks to drive. Inside edge onto boot and into the covers
length at middle stump, tickled through square leg off the back foot
full at off stump, defended on the front foot after shaping to slog
full and flat outside off, mistimes a cover drive
tossed up outside off, sliced to sweeper off the front foot
length ball pushed through quickly on middle. Pushed to extra cover
length at leg stump, blocked on the front foot
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full on off stump, single at mid-on with a drive
length at leg stump, driven to long-on with a jump down the track
length on middle stump, tapped to long-on
length at leg stump, poked back to the bowler
length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
length on off, flicked to midwicket's right
length on off stump, mistimed punch to extra cover
length just outside off, blocked from the crease
length outside off, looks to heave this past midwicket but can't find the timing
offcutter at a length outside off. Squeezed to sweeper's right with soft hands
short of a length on off stump, dropped in front of point with soft hands
length at middle stump, punched back towards the bowler
length on off stump, flicked to midwicket
lobbed up at middle stump, steps out and drives back to the bowler. He picks up and chucks it at the keeper
short of a length at middle stump, can't get the drive past Hafeez
length on off stump, pushed to extra cover on the up
length on middle stump, punched to long-off
lobbed up wide outside off, driven with the turn to long-on
length at middle stump, nudged to midwicket. Some late inswing there
length on off stump, tapped to midwicket with the angle

past the bowler and mid-off for four. That should be the first one in 21 overs. A nice shot. Length ball at off stump punched firmly back and Hasan slips in his follow through and can't stop that as a result
short and just outside off. Mistimed pull to midwicket's right
length and in at off stump, defended to cover from the crease
short at the hip height, swivels and pulls to deep square
punches this back to Imad
works this back past the bowler for an easy single
drifting into the pads, tucked wide of square leg for an easy single.
dropped by Sarfraz! Feeble push to take a thin edge, deflects off the glove and between his legs to short third man. Oh, dear. Just a split-second late to react was the captain.
pushed back towards the bowler.
drifts this into middle and leg, tucked into the gap at square leg for a quick single.
flays this length delivery outside off to point.
drills this extra cover drive to the sweeper
works this off a length on middle to midwicket
makes room but the bowler shortens his length and cramps him for room, blocked.
stands tall and tucks this into the leg side for a quick single.
angles in a full delivery close to middle from wide of the crease, stabbed away.
beaten on the drive as he can't get to the pitch of the ball
works this down to long-on
drifts in a length delivery on middle, tucked to midwicket
quicker and straighter on middle, worked to the leg side.
works this down to long-on
reaches out and then crashes it away past extra cover, down to the sweeper.
opens the face of the bat to steer this behind point
whipped uppishly and he's beaten mid-on. Too full, tailed in a little and Nicholls was ready to flick this away nicely. Cries of catch but this just eluded him
works this off a length on middle to deep square
punches this to mid-off and scampers a run. Malik with a quick throw, but just wide of the stumps.
gentle little dab to third man. Opened the bat face really late
gets onto his toes and bunts this into the leg side
reaches out and drives with the spin to deep extra cover
punches this shortish delivery down to wide long-on
gentle dab into the off side towards point to bring up another half-century
shortish delivery on middle, punched towards extra cover.
lunges a long way forward and smothers this quite nicely.
floats this full on the stumps, squeezed back.
yorker-length but just outside off, Taylor looks to squeeze this behind point but is beaten for pace.
angles one back in, length quite full, turns this gently into the leg side
pulled imperiously in front of square. Deep square thought he had a chance but the ball kept eluding him, as if it was running down a slope. Sublime timing.
full, around off stump, defended towards mid-off.
steers this down to square third man, Hasan Ali comes around to cut that off.
crisp little drive but straight to extra cover.
too full, Taylor crashes this drive to sweeper cover.
steps out and drives hard to long-off.
sharp turn, but Taylor carefully dabs this towards the man coming in from cover for a quick single.
doesn't quite get to the pitch, so this mistimed lofted hit lands short of long-on
drift and turn from middle, Taylor drops an run into the off side.
makes room and punches this skiddy length ball to point.
length on middle and leg, tucked to deep backward square leg for an easy single.
squirts this off a leading edge towards mid-off, looks for a single but is sent back.

he's delivered a vital breakthrough and brings out his 'boom' celebration! Nicholls steps out to swing this length ball into the leg side. Mid-off and mid-on were up, so he looked to go leg side. But this is an off-cutter which the batsman didn't anticipated, played early, missed it altogether and saw his stumps rattled.
shows the full face of the bat as he keeps out this length delivery.
veers back in to beat the inside edge and hit him on the pad, but this would've been slipping down leg.
works this length delivery into the leg side with soft hands.
googly which he works down to long-on for an easy single
skids one through on middle, whipped to deep square leg.
driven with the spin towards the man coming in from sweeper cover.
right forward as he defends back to the bowler.
squeezes this full delivery down to long-on as he jogs the single.
tickled away, but not sure if there was some bat. Looks like it clipped the pad along the way. Hasan with the chase and a rocket throw. Super stuff
late reverse back in, driven back. Good stop off his own bowling.

big, big appeal for lbw as this length ball angles in to beat the inside edge and hit the pad. It looked very adjacent, Sarfraz thinks for a while and reviews. Surprised they didn't go upstairs immediately. No inside edge, didn't hit him too high either. But ball tracking says this would've just grazed leg stump, so it stays as umpire's call.
turns this from length outside off to the leg side. Hasan Ali is definitely getting the ball to reverse late.
through with the short-arm jab even before the ball arrived, beaten by this 140kph length ball through to Sarfraz.
wrists this into the gap at midwicket
low full toss angling into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
length on the pads, tapped to midwicket
length outside off, driven with the turn to cover
chips straight to long-on. A nervous-looking shot. This is lobbed right up and in his reach for a big swing. But it isn't a big swing. Ends up lobbing it harmlessly for long-on
length ball outside off, rips past the outside edge as he looks to defend
length outside off, jumps up rapidly past the outside edge
slider at a length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
length at off stump, tapped back to the bowler
length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler on the up
short of a length just outside off, chopped to point's right
length on middle stump, flicked to long-on with the angle
short of a length and skidding away outside off. Can't connect on the cut
length outside off, guided straight to slip with the turn
short of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover
length at the stumps, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
length and sliding through at off stump. Can't get this forward block away either
tossed up at off stump, driven sweetly to extra cover's left and his dive isn't enough to stop a run
short of a length outside off, mistimed cut to point
nicely played but it's only a run. Full ball at off stump, gets down under it and ramps to deep backward square's right
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length at leg stump, clipped into the open infield on the leg side
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine's left
length ball into the pads. Copped on the pad as he looks to flick
full on leg stump, steps out to flick, can't get it past midwicket
length on off stump, nudged wide of cover and the direct hit doesn't get him, he has made it
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, driven against the turn to long-on
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length at the stumps, can't get the flick off the pitch
length just outside off, looks to reverse sweep, it trickles into the short third man region off the back of the bat
crash! Southee clears the front leg to make room and allow this full ball to angle into him before pumping it on the bounce to the midwicket boundary
down the pitch and chipped over the bowler. Didn't get to the pitch of that after stepping out, long-off cleans up to his right
inside edge as he looks to heave this from middle stump. Lobbed up slowly at a length and it ends up at short fine
length ball at off stump, pushed straight to extra cover who would have got Taylor with a direct hit at the non-striker's end
yorker length outside off, looks to drill through the off side but it's an inside edge past the keeper

Imam! Lobs it up for himself with his right hand after running in a bit too much from deep square. Then he gets his balance right and holds on. Nice adjustment in the end, because that could have looked very embarrassing. It was a slower ball outside off and Southee dragged it in that direction
yorker length just outside off, dug out into the cover region
full on off stump, driven straight to extra cover
offcutter at a length in the corridor, hangs the bat out and is thoroughly beaten
full and at the stumps. Jammed back down the pitch
short of a length and climbing up in the corridor. Looks to slices it behind point but won't make connection
yorker at middle stump, can't get under it. Digs it out through the open infield and Sodhi has to dive as he finishes the second
nicely bowled. Inswinging yorker at leg stump. Dabbed away towards long-on...and he's probably miffed that it'll only be a single. Because Hasan has overstepped
superb bowling. Yorker just outside off and Sodhi can't get it away
between deep midwicket and long-on. Hasan misses the yorker marginally and that's enough, even for a No. 9 batsman at this level. Swings cleanly and it's two bounces and into the boundary
buh bye! Sodhi pumps it flat over long-on! Hasan tries the back-of-the-hand slower ball and it sits up beautifully for a pasting on a good length outside off. He clubs it with a flat bat
yorker at leg stump, tapped into his front pad off the inside half
slower ball dropped short outside off. Gets deep in the crease and pulls to deep square
yorker at off stump, clipped to long-on's right
slower ball at a length. Sodhi jumps into the leg side to make room but is through the slog too early. It climbs over the stumps
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on that
top edge as he looks to slog an offcutter. Length and in the corridor, it ends up at third man

bowled him! Top bowling from the youngster. Gets the offcutter in at middle stump from wide of the crease. Sodhi swings for the angle but is done by the deviation. It's how he gets wickets, but he's powerless against this. Middle stump tonked.
yorker at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length at middle stump, backs away and nudges to point's right
delicious. An inswining yorker with middle stump on the radar. Boult backs away to try and slice this but he misses. Splits middle and off
length in the corridor, gets behind the line and runs it to third man
length at middle stump, shuffles and looks to whip it behind square. Inside edge onto pad rolls back down the pitch. that was there for hitting...
clears long-on! Vintage Taylor, a step into the off side and all hands to loft over the leg side. Hasan missing his length again.
slower ball dropped short outside off, walks at it and swats a pull to deep square's left. The dive and recovery means Taylor can come back for the second
walks at it again and meets it on the full. But his whip off the pads goes straight to deep square
hurried into the defensive stroke to a length ball angling in.
full and swinging away, driven wide of mid-off for a quick single
punched on the up into the gap at point. This moved away appreciably, and Fakhar just used the pace to ease it away quite nicely. The point fielder dived over the ball, stopped by the boot
more work for square third man. Again too much width and Fakhar punched this away into the gap.  Excellent work by the boundary rider again, George Worker
moves away from outside off, plays inside the line as this zips through to the keeper.
confident forward stride as he eases this full delivery into the covers.
full and swinging in from over the wicket, looks to whip behind square but is hit on the pad.
yorker-length ball on middle which he squeezes back.
full and swinging back into the pads, flicked to square leg.
banged in short and angling away Fakhar looks to fetch the pull from outside off but is late on the stroke.
short and wide, slapped away but an excellent half-stop at backward point to keep it to a single.
length on middle and leg, tucked behind square for an easy single.
straightens his length, on middle, defended back.
gets this to nip back in off a length on middle and off, defended with his bat close to the body

stands tall and punches this to mid-off, and has to really scamper and use his full stretch to complete the run. It's a different matter that there was no direct hit. Fakhar had the extra couple of yards to make up because he was so far inside the crease, no damage done in the end.
right on top of the bounce as he defends this back with soft hands.
arches back and watches this bouncer zip past.
hustled for pace with an excellent short ball, but equally well played by Imam.
full and swinging back into the pads, once again can't connect because he plays down the wrong line in trying to flick this away.

straying into the pads, flicked into the gap at deep backward square leg this time. Super work in the deep. First the slide by Boult followed by the parry back inside the field of play. Outstanding work
angles a full delivery across, a hint of movement back in. Left alone.
length on middle and leg, worked off his hip to deep square as they jog the single.
toe-ends this attempted punch to the cover fielder.
this is a super shot, using the bowler's pace to lace this square of the wicket on the off side. Lovely to watch
squared up a hint but he's on top of the bounce in defending that.

expects the ball to nip away but Boult raps him on the pad with one that nips back in. No part of leg stump was visible, which is perhaps an indication it may have been slipping down. He was also hit on the flap of the pad.
right on top of the bounce as he turns this into the leg side.
cracker of a delivery! Full, moves away late from off stump to beat his forward prod.
squirts this into the off side, towards point.
full and straight as he attacks the stumps, worked wide of mid-on for a quick single.
slants a length ball across, eased down to third man
caressed back past the bowler, mid-on with a sliding stop.
angles one back into middle and leg from round the stumps, worked to deep square
gets on top of the bounce and bunts this wide of point.
hit on the pad against this full delivery swinging back in. Once again late on the flick shot.
pulled away, not in control but he beats short fine leg. Deep square had too much ground to cover, and this is a welcome boundary.
angles in a full delivery from wide of the crease, Imam looks to work it through midwicket but turns the bat face too early and gets a leading edge that rolls to the off side.
slips this full delivery down leg, searching for late swing but there's none this time. May have tickled the pad on the way. Boult went up in an appeal more out of hope than anything.
shortens his length but gets the angle wrong this time, sliding down leg, this time it touches no part of the body or his equipment
gets half a stride in and punches to cover
sways out of the way of this short ball outside off.
steps out, makes room and wallops this length delivery over the infield, between cover and mid-off. Just a couple of steps out before he made sweet connection
slips this full and into the pads, Imam can't lay bat, tickles off the pad to short fine. Big appeal from Boult but no one supported him, so no strength in the appeal.
bunts this down to square third man for an easy single.
right behind the line as he defends.
deceived by the slower delivery as he wafts outside the line, thick inside edge into the leg side.
squirts this off a thick outside edge past gully for an easy single
slower, dipping full toss which he mistimes to mid-on but gets a run nevetheless
slower length ball on middle and leg, works this into the midwicket region.
beauty! Length ball that moves away late and beats the outside edge as he draws him into a punch.
flicks this full delivery from middle to square leg, the bat face turned as he made contact. Fakhar has struggled when the bowlers have attacked the stumps
slaps this away but can't pierce the packed off side ring, straight to point.
top shot! Banged in short and he swivelled nice and early to pull this all along the ground to the deep backward square leg fence. Picked the length early that time

whipped and he's picked the bones out of this, to get this to the midwicket boundary. Strong bottom-hands from Fakhar. By no means a half-volley but generated tremendous power as he made contact. Fakhar is slowly starting to rev up
punched into the gap between cover and mid-off for a quick single.
length on middle, defended back.
off a thick inside edge, couple of bounces to mid-on.
half-tracker down leg, looks to swivel and pull over short fine but played too early. Beaten.
punched on the up to point
full and swinging back in from outside off, squeezed to mid-on for a quick single
slower and fuller, he advances down the pitch and ends up yorking himself, squeezed away somehow into the off side.
steps out, the bowler angles it into the leg side from round the stumps, defended.
short and wide outside off, looks to pummel it wide of mid-on with a pull but he gets it onto his boot

leading edge falls short of cove point. Closes the face too early this time. On evidence of the first two balls, Lockie is coming on slower than expected. This was a length ball climbing up at the ribs
length at off, dropped into the covers with soft hands
length at leg stump, tapped to midwicket on the up
full and down leg side, flicked to fine leg with the angle
length at off stump, tapped to extra cover on the up
length and in at middle stump from around the wicket. Punched to long-on off the back foot
short and wide and filthy. So far away, he can only get the toe-end on the cut to sweeper cover. That's fifty for the opening pair
length at middle stump, nudged off the front foot
length at off stump, steps out and drives to long-off
length at middle stump, steps out and jams this out to long-on
short and wide outside off, gets deep in the crease and cuts past point

Imam has been struck on the grille by a bouncer. Or has that got a bit of his chin as well? He's on the floor now, but he is conscious. That bouncer climbed up sharply as he looked to hook it. Slow-mo suggests it his his grille on the side of the head and deflected onto his bicep. So there's no direct contact to the face or head. That's a good sign.
short and just outside off. Punched firmly as he gets on top of the bounce, but extra cover flies to his left to stop that
short and rising in the corridor, gets under it this time and swipes at it. Not totally in control, but he gets it wide of third man
short and wide outside off, takes it on with a cut but that's into the covers off the toe-end
short and on off stump. Solidly behind this to defend off the back foot
short at off stump, cramped as he defends off the back foot
length at leg stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot
big lbw appeal but the googly surely pitched outside leg. Fakhar looks to sweep and is beaten
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
full at leg stump, tapped back to the bowler on the bounce
full at the pads, can't get the sweep away
short of a length and spinning in at leg stump, punched to extra cover as it spins back in rapidly
just clears leg gully! Bouncer up at his ribs and he hooks uppishly and hurriedly. No chance to keep that down, so he chucks his hands at it and it's over the catching fielder
yorker at leg stump, shuffles and jams it out to get it between bowler and mid-on. Good batting
short of a length just outside off, tapped to cover off the back foot
bouncer slanted across the corridor. Left alone

what a player. Something will have to go really wrong if this guy doesn't end up a legend of the game. Glorious cover driving - high elbow, half a stride, right behind the line of that one and a firm tap at this length ball outside off
length just outside off, defended into the point region
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length on off stump, gets deep in the crease and clips it to midwicket
length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
length down leg side, past the attempted ramp
full at off stump, driven against the turn to wide long-off
full outside off, big stride and a flick to long-on
length outside off, down the track and a punch to long-off
short and lifting up rapidly outside off. Past Fakhar before he can get the bat up for the cut
144kph, jumping up nastily in the corridor again. Fakhar well leg side of this as he fishes and misses
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full on middle stump, an ungainly swipe across the line and Lockie's pace adds enough to the inside half of the bat for the to sprint to the midwicket boundary
short of a length just outside off, dropped into the covers with soft hands
whack. Babar is not letting Ferguson do anything. This is domination. 146kph, short and wide outside off and it's a graceful slash to get this square cut behind point
length and in at the pads, nudged through square leg off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, punched to mid-off on the up
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
short of a length at leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
short and just outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man's left
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
short of a length on off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
full outside off, driven neatly to sweeper's left
short at middle stump, punched to long-on
short at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full at leg stump, flicked straight to square leg

four and fifty. How he's needed this, Fakhar. Short and wide outside off and he waits for it to arrive and cuts behind point. It's symbolic of his innings today - he's finally given himself time and it has translated into a good knock
short and wide outside off, cut straight to point
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
full outside off, driven firmly to extra cover
length and down leg side. Flicked to fine leg
length and in at the corridor. Taps it into the covers
full on middle stump, punched past the non-striker
paddles this away towards fine leg.
steps out and works this with the spin towards wide long-on.
shortens his length as he skids this into middle, punched to long-on.
googly which he didn't read as he stabbed forward, off a thick edge to short third man.
steps out but Sodhi cleverly shortens his length, turned into the leg side. Looks for a single but is sent back.
goes right back into the crease and turns this to square leg.
hint of movement away off a length on off, dabbed to point
movement away as he bowls full, eased to cover
curves away late as he bowls this full on middle, squeezed back down the pitch.
too straight and angling into the pads, worked to deep midwicket
length on middle, worked to midwicket
stands tall and punches this length delivery outside off to point.
slants one full on the stumps, worked to mid-on
pulled but there's no timing, down to deep square leg.
banged in short, he looks to slash this over point but plays too early
drilled down the ground, terrific timing. Too full, too straight and the power Fakhar generated off the bottom hand was immense. No chance for mid-on despite Ferguson getting some hand on the dive.
too short, too wide and he's slapped this disdainfully to the cover boundary. Easy pickings.
half-tracker, he swivels back and belts the pull to deep midwicket.
floats one full on the pads, tucked to fine leg.
how lucky is he? Thick inside edge that flies past leg stump to fine leg.
length on middle and leg, whipped to deep midwicket
steps out to biff this over mid-on but can't get enough bat on it, squirted to the fielder off a thick inside edge.
attempts a forceful drive, once again can't lay enough bat on it, rolls into the off side.
full and straight on the stumps., hint of late movement but he solidly defends.
mistimes a pull into the midwicket region as they take a single.
opens the bat face late to lace this into the gap between cover and backward point. Just a hint of width and the timing is top-notch. Saeed Anwar-esque.
poor bowling. This is full and on the pads, clipped away to the deep square boundary. They're racing along here.
mistimes a pull to midwicket
fetches this pull from outside off, down to de Grandhomme at deep midwicket.
short-arm jab but boy, he's belted that to the midwicket boundary. Walked across to get outside the line and executed this to perfection. Stunning. Pakistan on overdrive
stands tall and punches to cover point. Guess what? There's an overthrow at the bowler's end and this races to the boundary. What are you doing, Trent Boult?
gets a thick outside edge as he looks to drive on the up, races to third man where Sodhi comes up with a sliding stop.
pulled away from outside off towards deep midwicket
full and angling in from wide of the crease, defended towards midwicket. Late tail in.
slower an fuller on middle and leg, turned behind square for an easy single.
width, and he slashes this straight to point.
slower bouncer to start, he ducks under this. Ball hardly rose.
another skiddy bouncer but this is way outside leg, rightly called wide.
superb short ball angling away, Babar sways out of the way as he watches this zip past.
short of length on middle and off, worked wide of midwicket
flicked but straight to midwicket.
drives, gets a thick inside edge to mid-on. Deceived by the change in pace.
looks like that ball slipped out of his hand to become a full toss outside off, slashed down to third man.
slower and fuller, closer to the stumps, defended.
flayed away into the gap behind point. Superb timing.
he's muscled this pull from outside off to the midwicket boundary. Sat up nicely, Fakhar picked the length early and gave this a proper wallop.
works this off a length from outside off towards deep midwicket.
poor bowling, slants one down leg, tickled to fine leg to raise the century stand
punches this length delivery to extra cover.
slaps this length ball to the diving point fielder.
top-edges this pull and Sodhi takes an excellent catch running in from mid-on. Looked to fetch the pull from way outside off, reached for it and didn't get any power behind that.
slashed away, one bounce to third man for a single.
play and a miss as he bowls another skiddy short ball into the body.
arches back to make room and he upper cuts this straight into the hands of Nicholls at third man. Little more bat and that would've sailed over the man there. Both set batsmen dismissed.
gets on top of the bounce and bunts it down.
hammers the pull from outside off towards deep midwicket
flayed away over point, down to square third man
what balance and timing as he swivels back and pulls in front of square to deep midwicket
right behind the line as he defends.
gets a good stride forward as he plays a copy book forward defence.
length on off, defended into the off side.
stands tall and punches this short ball into the gap at extra cover for a couple.
right on top of this short ball as he steers this into the off side.
slashed up and over point, down to square third man for a single.
superb bouncer that hustles Malik. He tried to ride the bounce but is caught on an awkward hop, nearly lobbed back to the bowler.
hops across and stabs this short ball into the off side.
ducks under this short ball bowled outside off.
slapped over extra cover. Too short, this was sitting up nicely for Malik, who also had the width. Raced to the boundary
length ball slanted into the pads from around the wicket. Flicked to fine leg
length at leg stump, flicked to fine leg
bouncer dug in too short. He ducks under it as it tails down leg side
length at off stump, pushed to cover point on the up
length on middle stump, flicked to deep square
length and down leg side, he looks to flick and seems to have missed it, but the umpire reckons there was contact on the way. Doesn't call a wide
length at off stump, flicked to deep square leg
short and pushed across the batsman. He gets on top of it and punches authoritatively through the covers
short of a length and slanted very wide outside off, left alone
bouncer dug in too short and way down leg side. Left alone
short and just outside off, sliced to deep backward point

it looks like a deflected catch at midwicket as Henry Nicholls, the short leg fielder, is down. Malik has smoked a pull shot straight into Nicholls and it seems to have caught his left shoulder. Sodhi takes the catch at midwicket, running in from mid-on. Nicholls is back on his feet. That was straight off his shoulder cap. He's okay.
short of a length and wide outside off. Feet rooted to the crease as he stabs this to point
short in the corridor, gets on top of the bounce and steers it to point's left
length and just outside off, defended on the front foot
length outside off, punched on the up to cover
length outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
yorker at leg stump. Dug out into the off side
short of a length in the corridor, guided down to third man
short of a length and angling in towards the corridor. Rushes him on the cut and beats the outside edge
length ball outside off, tapped on the up to cover's right where Boult slips and lets it through as he lunges to his right
length on off stump, tapped pitch side on the off side with soft hands
short and very wide outside off, left alone
bouncer just outside off. Rides the bounce and drops this into the turf with soft hands
thick outside edge clears gully. Short and wide and he chucks the bat at this with the cut. CDG cleans up at third man
short and wide outside off, through the cut early and he under-edges it into the pitch

appeal for caught behind is turned down. Bouncer at the ribs, closes his eyes as he looks to hook this. On first look it appears he go an inside edge onto shoulder, but New Zealand's easy acceptance of the not-out decision suggests that might not be the case
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length at leg stump, whipped to fine leg
slower ball just outside off. Waits for it deviate away and deflects to third man
bouncer. Too short. Doesn't even need to try and duck that.
length on leg stump, nudged to fine leg with the angle
full and onto the pads, stays put and tickles this fine
full on off stump, driven straight to mid-off
short and across off stump. Nicely on top as he punches through cover
short one rising up at the underarm. Leaps and shovels to fine leg
bouncer across off stump. Gets too steep for him as he fends at this. Past the outside edge
short of a length on off stump, punches through the vacant mid-off region off the back foot
short ball at the right shoulder. He can't get over this and flails with the hook. It's uppish, but it's between fine leg and deep square and it's four
dropped at leg gully. Another hook from under the speeding bouncer. This time he hits it straight at Southee. Well, a little over him anyway. It bursts through his reverse cup
dropped short outside off, pulls as this turns away from him. Gets it out to deep square's left
short and very wide outside off. Skids away and gets big too. Sarfraz doesn't get the feet back and across and is sort of reaching for this with the cut. Thick edge is held on
googly, short and down leg side. Whipped to deep square off the back foot
short outside off, pulled to long-on against the turn
googly rips in as he shapes to cut. Under-edge into the pitch as he looks to cut
length outside off, reaches out with hard hands and doesn't get to the pitch. Sliced uppishly between cover and point
short of a length on leg stump, defended into the leg side
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length at off stump, hurriedly jabbed to point's left off the back foot
length and in the corridor. Defended to point
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length and skidding on at middle stump. Swivels for the pull but it hits the sticker of the bat and rolls to short midwicket
floated up full outside off, driven towards long-off. Extra cover cuts it off
short of a length just outside off, cut to point
short of a length just outside off, punched to cover
length just outside off, defended to point off the outside half
googly, short of a length at off stump. Backs away and slices to point
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at leg stump, flicked straight to square leg from the crease
length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
chops it past short third. Short of a length just outside off, hangs leg side of it and guides it to that fielder's right
